result.execSummary:
The defendant Palu T Yang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: May not possess any dangerous weapons.
No contact with victim J.V. unless approved by agent.
Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.   

AODA and follow through.  

Comply with Anger Management classes.  

Write a letter of apology to MCSD deputies involved.  

DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Palu T Yang

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 9:30 am. 
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears, pro se. 
VRCW. 

State makes sentencing argument. 
Defendant makes sentencing argument. 

COURT ORDERS: 
Ct.1(DC)>>SWH 1 year probation.  CONDITIONS:  I/S 30 days MCJ for rule violations.  Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  AODA and follow through.  Comply with Anger Management classes.  Write a letter of apology to MCSD deputies involved.  No contact with victim J.V. unless approved by agent.  May not possess any dangerous weapons.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

COURT grants 1 day credit. 
Adj: 9:45 am.

Exhibit List from Jury Trial;
Exhibit 1- USB Drive with 911 Recording (not scanned in; Kept in Storage)
Guilty
Jurors Selection and Peremptory Challenges (List of sworn jurors)
Sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Clerk: Heather; 
Case called: 8:32 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears in person, pro se.
Date and time set for a Jury Trial.

COURT questions states final offer;
Defendant rejects the offer and wishes to proceed with trial.
COURT reviews Jury Trial procedure.
Parties discuss Jury instructions. 
Parties discuss statement of the case.
COURT recesses @ 8:50 a.m. 
BAILIFF OPENS COURT @ 9:13 a.m. 
Jury Panel is present and sworn @ 9:14 a.m. 
COURT introduces the case; Counsel introduces themselves & names potential witnesses;
Voir Dire by the Court @ 9:15 a.m. 
Voir Dire by the State @ 9:18 a.m. 
Parties make their strikes @ 9:54 a.m. 
COURT reads Jurors selected @ 10:02 a.m. 
Court thanks & excuses those not selected;
Selected Jury Panel sworn @ 10:03 a.m. 
COURT reads Preliminary Jury Instructions @ 10:04 a.m. 
COURT instructs the Jury;  
JURY recesses @ 10:11 a.m. 
COURT recesses @ 10:12 a.m. 
COURT reconvenes @ 10:30 a.m. 
Parties discuss audio evidence. 
JURY reconvenes @ 10:32 a.m. 
The State makes Opening Statements @ 10:34 a.m. 
Defendant makes Opening Statement @ 10:39 a.m. 
J.V. sworn in and testifies; Identifies Defendant. 
Sidebar @ 10:59 a.m. 
Testimony continues. 
 Captain William Millhousen sworn in and testifies.
Exhibit 1 played @ 11:13 a.m. - 11:25 a.m. 
Deputy Anthony Bonisolli sworn in and testifies; Identifies Defendant. 
State rests.
JURY recess for lunch @ 11:35 a.m. 
COURT reviews sidebar on record.
COURT reviews right to testify with Defendant.
Defendant wishes to not testify.
COURT finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives his rights to testify.
Defense rests. 
COURT recesses for lunch @ 11:41 a.m. 
COURT Reconvenes @ 12:17 p.m. 
COURT holds jury instruction conference.
COURT recesses @ 12:25 p.m. 
COURT reconvenes @ 12:34 p.m. 
Parties review Jury instructions.
ADA McGarry makes statement re: closings.
JURY reconvenes @ 12:38 p.m. 
COURT reads Jury instructions @ 12:39 p.m.
State makes Closing Arguments @ 12:50 p.m. 
Defendant makes Closing Arguments @ 1:01 p.m. 
Sidebar @ 1:03 p.m. 
Defendant's closing arguments continue. 
State makes Rebuttal Closing Arguments @ 1:05 p.m.
COURT reads charge and further instructs the Jury; 
Bailiffs sworn @ 1:09 p.m. 
Jury exits to deliberate @ 1:10 p.m. 
COURT reviews sidebar on record.
COURT recesses @ 1:11 p.m. 
COURT reconvenes @ 1:29 p.m. 
Jury enters with a Verdict @ 1:29 p.m. 
COURT reads the Verdict aloud:
CT 1 (Disorderly Conduct)>>GUILTY.
COURT polls the jury; 
COURT excuses & thanks Jurors.

State makes Motion to enter Judgment onto record. Bond Continues. 
Parties schedule sentencing hearing with JA. 

Adj: 1:34 p.m.

Case Called: 8:16 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry in person. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
VRCW.
Defendant has filed a Motion to Dismiss yesterday.
State makes arguments. Defendant makes arguments. 
Court Denies Motion to Dismiss. 
Parties address the State's Motion in Limine. Court Rules on MIL- 
Parties address the State's Motion in Limine regarding Prior Convictions- Court Grants Motion and the Answer to be : (Yes-2).
House keeping matters to be taken up the morning of Trial. Jury Trial to remain on the calendar.
Adjourned: 8:30 am

Defendant's Motion to Dismiss
CD Provided as Exhibit - Exhibit is kept in storage
Motion hearing on September 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Case Called: 8:58 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry in person. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
VRCW.
Court addresses the Defendant regarding counsel status;
Defendant has filed a Motion to Dismiss. Parties are to address the Motion filed by the Defendant tomorrow.
Parties make statements. Court advises the Defendant to provide a copy of Motion to the State. 

DATES:
Motion Hearing (Motion to Dismiss) 09/27/2022 @ 8:15 am

Adjourned: 9:03 am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant requests speedy trial at 08/30/22 Jury Status Hearing

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:48 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, pro se. 
COURT questions deft re: counsel. 
Deft states wish to proceed without counsel. 
Deft requests discovery and speedy trial. 
COURT questions deft if he has completed waiver of right to counsel form. 
Deft states he did not understand form and did not wish to sign form. 
Deft continues to assert wish to proceed without counsel and assert he is able to represent himself. 
COURT reviews waiver of atty form with deft on the record. 
COURT finds deft has freely, voluntarily, and intelligently proceed without counsel. 
COURT finds deft competent to represent himself. 
COURT requests jury trial be adjourned for 9/8/2022. 
COURT removes jury trial set for 9/8/2022. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to set FPT and Jury Trial 
Adj: 2:03 pm

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case Called at 10:20 am.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears, pro se.
VRCW. 

Defendant does not wish to obtain counsel, and is wishing this matter goes to trial. 
Court directs defendant to fill out Waiver of Right to Counsel and Court will go through it with defendant at the next hearing. 

Adj: 10:23 am.
Defendant will represent self

Clerk: Amy
Case called at 9:41 a.m. 
Defendant appears in person.  

Date and time set for indigency hearing. 
COURT questions defendant re: financial disclosure statement. 
Defendant provides blank form to COURT. 
COURT explains form needs to be filled out; Defendant states he wishes to represent himself however Court can appoint an attorney if they want.  
Defendant attempts to discuss Motion to Dismiss; COURT advises defendant needs to file with responsible Branch.  

COURT adjourns matter; defendant wishes to represent himself.  

Next hearing>>>PTC  6/01/22 at 2:00 p.m. 

Adj:  9:44 a.m. 

c. Branch 3.

Indigency hearing on May 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Jury status hearing on August 3, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Jury Trial on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): J.V. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:39 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Reading Waived.  
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights. 
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Deft states he does not qualify for public defender representation. 
Deft moves to dismiss case. 
COURT denies motion. 

PLEA: Not Guilty by Court. 

Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $1000 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): JV. 
- No possession of dangerous weapons. 

Deft requests change of venue. 
COURT notes deft needs to file motions in writting. 

BRANCH 3 CASE.

PTC with JA: 6/1/2022 at 2:00 pm. 
FPT: 7/28/2022 at 10:20 am.
